comment: Class for transforming elements in a Map to something else
codesample:
%REM
The following code filters out values that are odd numbers
%END REM
Class AgeIncrementer as MapTransformer
    Function transform(kvPair as Pair) as Boolean
        Dim person as Person
        Set person = kvPair.value
        person.age++
        Return new Pair(kvPair, person)
    End Function
End Class
Dim map1 as New Map(&quot;PERSON&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim map2 as Map(&quot;PERSON&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim incrementer as New AgeIncrementer()
&apos;Populate map1
Call map1.transform(incrementer, map2)

methods.label: transform
methods.comment:
Function to transform a member of a value. If there is no return value, the element is skipped and nothing gets added to the new Map for this element.
Thus this function can perform a filter and a transform simultaneously.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code filters out values that are odd numbers
%END REM
Class AgeIncrementer as MapTransformer
    Function transform(kvPair as Pair) as Boolean
        Dim person as Person
        Set person = kvPair.value
        person.age++
        Return new Pair(kvPair, person)
    End Function
End Class
Dim map1 as New Map(&quot;PERSON&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim map2 as Map(&quot;PERSON&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim incrementer as New AgeIncrementer()
&apos;Populate map1
Call map1.transform(incrementer, map2)
